text:
JEANNE MOOS: Bill O'Reilly
has traded "The No Spin
Zone" for the no-jobs zone.

One cartoonist hung
a "Gone Groping"
sign on O'Reilly's door.

JIMMY KIMMEL: Bill
O'Reilly was fired today.
[cheering]

JEANNE MOOS: Talk
show audiences--

CONAN O'BRIEN: Fox News
fired Bill O'Reilly.
[cheering]
JEANNE MOOS: --seemed delighted.
WHOOPI GOLDBERG: Bill O'Reilly--
[cheering]
[sneezing]

WHOOPI GOLDBERG:
--is out at Fox.
God bless you.

And everybody in the
room, God bless us all.

JEANNE MOOS: The
hosts of "The View"

then reminisced about the
time they walked off the set
after arguing with O'Reilly.
He sure had a way with words.

BILL O'REILLY: Well, say
you're a cocaine dealer--

and you kind of look
like one a little bit.
MARC LAMONT HILL: As do you.
You look like a cocaine user.

DAVID LETTERMAN: In my mind,
I think of you as a goon.
[laughter]

BILL O'REILLY: Now, I
didn't hear a word she said.

I was looking at
the James Brown wig.

JEANNE MOOS: "Hey Bill,
how you like my wig now?"
read one tweet.
Like magic-- poof--
Bill O'Reilly disappeared.

Posters outside Fox saying,
"nobody moves this man,"
were moved.

His name vanished from
his show, mockingly

compared to Stalin,
airbrushing out
comrades who fell from grace.

Stephen Colbert resurrected
his old conservative pundit
character based on O'Reilly.

STEPHEN COLBERT: You
failed Bill O'Reilly.

All he ever did
was have your back.

And if you're a woman, you know,
have a go at the front, too.

JEANNE MOOS: Comedians reprised
O'Reilly's most macho moments.

BILL O'REILLY: Cut his mic.
Cut his mic.
Cut her mic off.
Because you're lying.
Come on, you coward.

JEANNE MOOS: And
then rubbed it in.

TREVOR NOAH: Unlike Bill
O'Reilly, we'll be right back.

JEANNE MOOS: Funny
or Die did a mash-up

of Vin Diesel and
O'Reilly's infamous outtake.

BILL O'REILLY:
Whatever it is, it's
not right on the teleprompter.

I don't know what that
is, I've never seen that.
We'll do it live.

[MUSIC - WIZ KHALIFA, "SEE YOU
 AGAIN"]

BILL O'REILLY: We'll
do it live, [bleep] it.

WIZ KHALIFA: [singing] First
you both go out your way, and--

JEANNE MOOS: In honor of a
loud host, a moment of silence.
Jeanne Moos.

STEPHEN COLBERT: Stay
strong, papa bear.
JEANNE MOOS: CNN, New York.

STEPHEN COLBERT: Oh God,
is this really happening?
